intro: Bunium kopetdagense, commonly known as the Kopetdag fennel, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its seeds are small and oval, with a distinctive aroma similar to fennel. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
